trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Veracode | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Veracode | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Veracode with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Veracode with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Veracode
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Veracode

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Veracode.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Veracode.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Veracode single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Veracode single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Veracode will be able to single sign into the application using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Veracode will be able to single sign into the application using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Veracode
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Veracode

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Veracode
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Veracode

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Veracode.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Veracode.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Veracode, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Veracode, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Veracode.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Veracode.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Veracode, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Veracode, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Veracode</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Veracode</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Veracode with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Veracode with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Your Veracode application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Veracode application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Veracode application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Veracode application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Veracode page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Veracode page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Veracode page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Veracode page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Veracode company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Veracode company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Settings, and then click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Settings, and then click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the SAML tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SAML tab.

trans-unit.source: In the Organization SAML Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Organization SAML Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Veracode dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Veracode dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded certificate, click Choose File.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded certificate, click Choose File.

trans-unit.source: Select Enable Self Registration.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable Self Registration.

trans-unit.source: In the Self Registration Settings section, perform the following steps, and then click Save:
trans-unit.target: In the Self Registration Settings section, perform the following steps, and then click Save:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As New User Activation, select No Activation Required.
trans-unit.target: As New User Activation, select No Activation Required.

trans-unit.source: As User Data Updates, select Preference Veracode User Data.
trans-unit.target: As User Data Updates, select Preference Veracode User Data.

trans-unit.source: For SAML Attribute Details, select the following:
trans-unit.target: For SAML Attribute Details, select the following:

trans-unit.source: User Roles
trans-unit.target: User Roles

trans-unit.source: Policy Administrator
trans-unit.target: Policy Administrator

trans-unit.source: Reviewer
trans-unit.target: Reviewer

trans-unit.source: Security Lead
trans-unit.target: Security Lead

trans-unit.source: Executive
trans-unit.target: Executive

trans-unit.source: Submitter
trans-unit.target: Submitter

trans-unit.source: Creator
trans-unit.target: Creator

trans-unit.source: All Scan Types
trans-unit.target: All Scan Types

trans-unit.source: Team Memberships
trans-unit.target: Team Memberships

trans-unit.source: Default Team
trans-unit.target: Default Team

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Attribute Name
trans-unit.target: Attribute Name

trans-unit.source: Attribute Value
trans-unit.target: Attribute Value

trans-unit.source: firstname
trans-unit.target: firstname

trans-unit.source: User.givenname
trans-unit.target: User.givenname

trans-unit.source: lastname
trans-unit.target: lastname

trans-unit.source: User.surname
trans-unit.target: User.surname

trans-unit.source: email
trans-unit.target: email

trans-unit.source: User.mail
trans-unit.target: User.mail

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Value textbox, select the attribute value shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Value textbox, select the attribute value shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Veracode, they must be provisioned into Veracode.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Veracode, they must be provisioned into Veracode.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Veracode, provisioning is an automated task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Veracode, provisioning is an automated task.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you..
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you..

trans-unit.source: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.
trans-unit.target: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Veracode user account creation tools or APIs provided by Veracode to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Veracode user account creation tools or APIs provided by Veracode to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Veracode, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Veracode, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Veracode **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Veracode **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
